title: Peter Dale Scott08/12/2012
content:
Scott is a poet, author, researcher, former Canadian diplomat and UC, Berkeley English Professor Emeritus. He’s also a critic of US imperial policies.
He coined the phrase “deep politics.” He defines it as follows: It “posits that in every culture and society there are facts which tend to be suppressed, because of the social and psychological costs of not doing so.
” They include covert criminal policies, unaccountable lawlessness, disturbing truths like 9/11, and today’s troubling environment.
Major world and national issues will be discussed.
